5007.mail_desc:
Dear Admin,
In the latest update, we have deleted the Sigil Shard item. The %s Sigil Shards you owned have been automatically converted into Revelation items of the same value, and are attached to this message.

6001.mail_desc:
I've finished adjusting the Hazard Zone Cleaning system. Come and try it out if you've got the time, as I need more data.

Oh, and this is for you. I wouldn't recommend going in too often, as it can be quite wearing on the spirit, but if you feel up to it, an extra round won't hurt. Use it as you see fit.

Anyway, I've got research to be... researching. See you later.

6002.mail_desc:
Well, well, rookie, the wise Lord Mimir won't forget this important day!
Haha. Time flies. It seems like yesterday when you first commanded a battle, and before you know it you've grown into a reliable leader. Think about it, along the way, you and the Modifiers have fought together to overcome many obstacles, and I have a well-stored record of all your wonderful performances.
Let me, the wise Lord Mimir say to you on behalf of everyone in Aether Gazer - Happy Birthday, Admin!
Everyone has prepared a birthday gift for you. There might be some surprises, so hurry up and open it. Hic!

6003.mail_desc:
Well, I wouldn't have agreed to come to the party if Shu hadn't reminded me again and again.
Think about it, everyone getting together just to sing a song, that's pretty boring, isn't it?
But - if you are coming to this Arrival Day party, it'll definitely be fun, hehehe.
Remember that promise you made before? About the game? Hmph, I've been noticing that you haven't been online since we played together that time.
Now here's another chance for you: Get online and help me decorate the room in that game we played together last time.
Of course, I've made some small "designs" in the game. If you accidentally trigger them...
Let's see if you'll pass it successfully, or become my... let's say, "accomplice"?

6004.mail_desc:
Actually, I am not good at writing letters... At first, I wanted to ask Zenki to write it for me. After all, she wrote a lot of self-disciplinary reports. However, she held a strange pen for half a day, scribbled down a meaningless title and left... So I had to continue on my own.
Well, from the very start of my memory, I've been in constant battle. So, just like everyone's impression of me as a fight enthusiast, I don't even remember anything outside of combat.
If we must commemorate a day like this, simply praise me for my strength as you always do. If my lightning can be of an aid to you, that would be far more thrilling than any Arrival Day celebration!
Come on Admin, I really see something defferent in you. If one day you're tired of sitting in the office, feel free to come to my Thunder Squad!
By the will of lightning, I will protect you.
And, remember that today is my Arrival Day (multiple underlines). Double chocolate bananas today! Double!
The pen seems to be getting worn out, so I'll just stop here.
These are for you, and next time I'll treat you to my grilled...
(The rest of the content is blotted by ink stains, which spread right up to the previous line quite noticeably. Looks like Thor intentionally blocked the ink with her cuff.)

6005.mail_desc:
Admin, are you available tonight? Let's have some drinks together?
Not for any particular reason, just that today is my Arrival Day. You've got to have some kind of reason to give yourself a break now and then. Don't you think?
Birthday... Yes, I still prefer to call it that. Birthdays used to remind me of my increasing age. But now, I'm going to look like this forever. It's good that I've experienced it all, so I have no regrets, haha!
Well... Why am I talking about these things?
Anyway, that's it. Today, let's just let go of those nerve-racking things and have some real fun!

6006.mail_title: Greetings from the Sun and the Trade Wind
6006.mail_desc:
Hey Admin, and everyone in Aether Gazer, do you miss me?
I recently took my annual leave, which I had been saving up for a long time, and went back to Omorfies for a vacation after a long time. I didn't realize that what I was thinking about the most here was each and every one of you. I'm actually a little uncomfortable that I don't have to deal with the pranks of Zenkibo when I'm out, haha.
But don't worry. Your Sun, never leaves everyone. It is bathing in the waves of Sea of Stars, and sending you all warm greetings and gifts as always through the trade wind.

6007.mail_title: Make Sure You Read Until the End
6007.mail_desc:
Long time no see, Administrator! I hope you've been well.
Time really flies! It feels like you've hit me with the Delusion Buster just yesterday, ha ha!
Alright, alright, I'll stop joking and get down to business. A few days ago, when I was exploring a well-known antique shop on Yuyi Isle, I came across a local clan that was celebrating the centenary of the eldest member of the clan. What a lively scene it was, and I couldn't help but walk in through the open door and help myself to the celebratory viands.
As I extended my wine cup for a refill, it suddenly occurred to me that my own Arrival Day was coming soon.
In the past, Lingguang would gather folks who are free for a party on such occasions. Although not everyone would make it to these parties, they were always full of warmth and laughter nevertheless.
Would you have the time to join us at the Quad for such a party?
Of course, you don't have to bring a gift.
(I'll let you in on a secret: the longevity noodles made by the Quad's chef are truly scrumptious! Alas, we are allowed to have them only once a year. But if you come, I'll share mine with you.)

6008.mail_title: So I Performed a Reading Just for Fun...
6008.mail_desc:
Admin, there's something I'd like to discuss with you...
Um, put simply, my research budget's been slashed, which means I'll have to stop several important studies of mine. The good thing is, I can perform a reading for you now. Weren't you interested in tarot card readings before?
And the payment I require, Admin, is your help in resubmitting all those budget requests. Alright, that's a deal! Performing your reading now...
And your card, Admin, is... the Fool. Hmm, I suppose that makes sense from what I know of you.
Don't get me wrong, this isn't an insult. A right-side-up Fool is a very good draw. It means that although you may seem a little reckless at first glance, and although you always persist along a path of danger, you'll end up gaining something quite unexpected...
Yeah, that sounds about right.
I keep getting the feeling that between you and I, you're getting the far better deal here.

6009.mail_desc:
HYAH! Hey, Admin!
Heh heh, I just learned this from Master during a mission: the way to call for your companions in the polar regions! What do you think? Cool, right? But of course, since Master was the one who taught it to me!
Because the weather can get rather rough all year round at the poles, you have to really yell to get your voice across, even if it's only a few meters.
Oh, that reminds me. I must thank you for recommending that Master and I go on that polar mission. You can leave all future missions there to us!
Only on missions like these can I get one-on-one time with Master... and learn more about survival in places like this from her!
HYAH!

6010.mail_desc:
It's been a while, Admin.
I've been working hard at learning from Master recently, for after what happened at Sasanami, I realized that there's still a lot I have to work on.
As a student of the sword, the one thing I have to do is to stay true and focused. However, I allowed myself to be affected by my feelings and nearly caused harm to Master and everyone else as a result...
I was going to train today too, until Master told me I should take a rest as today's an important day.
When I was young, I envied the other kids who celebrated their birthdays. But now, all I want is to become better at the sword.
But maybe it's not such a bad idea to take a break once in a while...
So, would you have some time tonight by any chance? If yes... come have a chat with me over here at the training room?
For some reason, I feel most assured when I'm in there.

6011.mail_desc:
Thanks for reminding me.
Had it not been for you and your dinner invite, I wouldn't have remembered that it's my Arrival Day today.
But I must respectfully decline. Time is precious, and we shouldn't be wasting it on frivolous pursuits.
I still have a number of reviews to perform, and I hope you can understand.
I do appreciate the thought, though.
...
Here's a little something from me by way of apology. You should find it useful since you train so often.
Let's have a meal the next time you come by to return the dumbbell. My treat.

6012.mail_desc:
Hey, Admin! I haven't seen you for a long time! I miss you!
It's my Arrival Day today. Would you celebrate it with me? And oh! There's a live action "Prime Codex" movie on! Wanna go watch it with me?
Also, I've come up with a new dish based on Chapter 20 of the "Prime Codex". But I seem to recall that you can't take spicy food? Your face turned all red the last time you tried something I made... I promise to use less spice this time!
Come on over! Be there or be square!

6013.mail_desc:
Dear Administrator of Aether Gazer, I hope this finds you well!
They tell me that you're the only one with certain responsibilities at Aether Gazer, so you must be pretty busy. But please take good care of yourself! Don't overwork yourself, and remember to take a break every now and then.
This morning, I was playing music in the courtyard as usual when I saw that a few water lilies in the pond had bloomed. It was only then that I realized that summer is upon us! Every time it's my birthday, I can't help but feel that time is moving too fast and there're so many things I've yet to accomplish... at the Quad, at Vermilion Wellness, and in life. But I always look forward to the people I'll meet and the new things I'll encounter in the coming year. For example: what are the two of us going to learn about each other?
As everyone knows, I'm not keen on big parties, and don't really do much for birthdays apart from writing and answering letters, and it was when I was responding to one such letter that I thought of you. I thought about what happened after we met at Tian Lu Traders, and what you didn't tell me about your health that day. It's been weighing on my mind, both as a doctor and as a friend. And the path of one who watches out and protects is a hard one.
I'm sorry for being such a wet blanket on a happy day like this. But I'm already so used to looking out for everyone's safety and well-being.
Come by Nanjiao Isle the next time summer rolls around if you wish. I'll be here. The water lilies here at Vermilion Wellness are beautiful when they're in full bloom!

6014.mail_desc:
Hi, Admin! I hope you've received the Shashvat specialty products I sent along with this letter!
The weather's getting real hot over here, and the kids pestered me into taking them out to a restaurant for some ice cream.
It turned out that they had organized an Arrival Day surprise for me at the restaurant: a curry-and-ice cream creation! I wonder how they came up with that, ahahaha!
They even made sure to leave some for you, but since you're so busy with work I'll take care of your portion for you.
Oh, by the way, they also made you a visor hat for when you next come to Shashvat. It looks pretty light and airy to me. I think it means they like you, heh.
You should come to Shashvat one of these summers!

6015.mail_desc:
Let me make this clear to you: not everyone is entitled to an invitation from yours truly. Now that you've received my handwritten invite, you'll have to have a really, really good reason before you can say no.
That's settled, then: you're attending the celebration of the occasion of my glorious arrival into this world.
You ought to, anyway. Surely, those chosen by one such as myself must go through the experience of attending a proper tea party. Remember the Ps and the Qs that I taught you! I won't help you if you make a fool of yourself.
You don't have to bring a gift. Besides, an item chosen with the eyes and acumen of a mediocre one will only mar the occasion. Just accept the souvenir I've painstakingly arranged for with gratitude in your heart. A souvenir that you, perhaps one day, will finally be able to appreciate. While I do see a wisp of talent in you, I don't expect you to develop enough taste and discernment by this time next year... Here's a gentle reminder that there are few critics in Omorfies who are more professional than my exceptional self.
Of course, you'll have to play your part at the tea party. As to how best to express your praise and good wishes for me on this occasion... It's time to put all of your knowledge and learning to good use!

6016.mail_desc:
Admin! I must say, I really like the mahjong tiles you gave me the other time.
Allow me to thank you by teaching you the game of mahjong!
This may seem incredible to you, but believe me when I say that I've closed countless deals over a game of mahjong.
While I don't deliberately seek to do so, how someone plays mahjong can tell you a lot about them, and if they're suited to be your business partner.
So, come play a game with me, and I'll tell you if you have what it takes to become a big shot at Aether Gazer! Ha ha, I kid, I kid.
Oh that's right, I've also been looking into the Sasanami style of mahjong recently.
Did you know that there's more than one winning hand in mahjong? There's the famous Thirteen Wonders, of course, as well as the Three Great Scholars and the Three Lesser Scholars, etc., etc...
Heh heh, don't worry, we'll start from the basics. No point shooting for the stars when you can't yet stand on your own two feet! To tell you the truth, what I enjoy most is working up a winning streak with the minor winning hands!

6017.mail_desc:
Haha! If it weren't for the auto-reminder system of Hearth of Danu, I'd have totally forgotten today is my Arrival Day.
Perhaps due to the rising temperatures, I've been flooded with appliance repair orders this month. And... You have to admit that the elderly sure possesses extraordinary creativity when it comes to feature design!
Take this "MeloChill" Watermelon Ice Bucket for example, an order from an old man with a sensitive stomach. Once linked with a vital signs monitoring bracelet, the bucket can adjust the temperature within in real-time, ensuring each bite you take of the fruit remains refreshingly cool without overly stimulating the digestive system...
And then there's this "Just-One-More-Episode" Portable Projector, a custom order from a soap opera-loving elderly woman. You know, watching TV for too long can strain your eyes, right? But sometimes, she just can't stand the suspense! So, I designed this projector, which downloads and decodes upcoming episodes while you're watching the current one. When your eyes start to feel tired, it generates a simulation signal to stimulate the visual cortex in your brain, letting you "watch" without actually watching... Of course, I've put strict controls on the extension period to keep it within reasonable limits.
Would you be interested in coming over to take these devices for a test run today? I have a little thank-you gift prepared for you, but let's keep that under wraps for now.
By the way, Kitty has recently been sent to me for maintenance and upkeep. She'd be thrilled to see you again, don't you think?

6018.mail_desc:
Each and every member of the Knights of Convallaria is entitled to time off to enjoy and celebrate their own birthday. This is a rule among the Knights, and as their leader, I must abide as well.
This rule goes back to the time when my grandmother Colleen was the commander. As Omorfies was not at peace then, every member of the Knights had to be on high alert all the time, and Colleen decided that everyone had to take at least a day off on their birthdays, no matter what.
This has since become our tradition, and I guess everyone is grateful to my grandmother for that. (Including myself, as I've already made plans for this day...)
Admin, I'd like to make it up to you for what happened the last time. Would you like to visit and see a little of Omorfies on Sept. 1st?
As I will not be on duty as a Knight of Convallaria, I'll be able to spend this special day of rest with you as myself, Athena Pallas.

6019.mail_desc:
Dear Admin, I hear that you've been really busy at work lately?
You should know that working for long periods of time can actually lower your efficiency. This is a scientific fact proven many times by both theory and practice. And sleep alone isn't enough for the human body to obtain complete rest. What is also needed is a certain amount of leisure activity that can help one relax.
There's this new restaurant in the neighborhood that apparently serves great fruit salad. It's a nice, quiet joint, so I think it'll be pretty relaxing to have a chat there.
Based on the above, want to have dinner there with me tonight, Admin?
Oh, by the way, I should mention that it's my Arrival Day today. Which in theory isn't a terribly special day, since the concept of birthdays doesn't exist for Modifiers.
However, spending quality time with others may be meaningful in itself in practice.
Therefore, I need your help as I study the effect of such behavior on dopamine levels in the brain.
This is an important and special experiment that will help us improve work efficiency levels in the General Office.
I'll be waiting for you at the restaurant tonight.

6020.mail_title: Just Got Back From the Trip
6020.mail_desc:
It's been a while since I last saw you, Admin. Is that insomnia of yours still bothering you? I've been there before, so shoot me a note through the terminal if you want some suggestions.
Now that the Pheasant Squad has completed the mission, we'll be back in Ain Soph in three days.
Thanks for that early Arrival Day gift you sent! I shared the snacks with the squad, and everyone thinks you have a gift for baking. As... do I.
Nuadha tells me that you made this necklace yourself...? (I didn't mean to be nosy, but we see each other very often because of the Access Keys...)
During battle, when I feel its coolness on my skin, my mind immediately quietens even if it's all hot outside.
And when I'm in a scrap with the enemy, I can feel it on my skin as I move, as if it's telling me to take care as someone faraway is thinking of me...
Do you have some time for me when I return to Aether Gazer? I also have something for you. Besides, I can't wait to share with you what happened on this trip.

6021.mail_title: Refund for unused Special VIP Invites
6021.mail_desc:
Dear Admin,
The Banquet Invitation event has now ended, and you still have %s unused Special VIP Invite(s).
Please find attached the refund you are owed for this: Shifting Flower ×%s and Shifted Star ×%s.

6022.mail_desc:
Dear Admin,
The Banquet Invitation event has now ended, and you still have %s unused Banquet Invite(s).
Please find attached the refund you are owed for this: Shifting Flower ×%s and Shifted Star ×%s.

6023.mail_desc:
Yoohoo, Admin! Long time no see!!!
We're on our way to do a big job, and Pops wants me to get some canned food for the trip. But canned food's awful expensive here in Rostach, GAAAH!
Bossman says that it should be much cheaper in Ain Soph since there are so many shops there. Heh, Admin, do you think you could send over some of that good stuff in that case?
Bossman also gave me a little extra cash for the food, saying that my "Arrival Day's" coming soon and we oughta celebrate that anyway. But what in the world is an "Arrival Day"...?
Whatever! A happy day is a happy day! I gotta say, Admin, Pops, Bossman, everybody's counting on me here, so please help me out here. I really need that cheap and tasty canned food!
Of course, I won't let you do this for free. You can take the money Bossman gave me and buy yourself something nice and yummy. Psst, here's my go-to recipe: get some tinned black bread, then add luncheon meat and fried fish to it. Then you gonna put some peanut butter on it, and finish with some tomatoes and chickpeas... Muack! Delish!
Man, I'm drooling now... I'll have to make do with some canned pickles for now. Hear from you soon, Admin!

6024.mail_desc:
Hiya Admin! Haven't seen you for a while. Wonder when you'll actually see this note.
Hmm, actually that's not quite true. I always walk past your office when I make deliveries to Aether Gazer, but I suppose you've been too busy working to notice me?
So anyway, I found all these presents on my desk at Olympia Express this morning, and I was so puzzled. I'd have just spent the rest of the day making deliveries had Iris not brought me a cake and told me to take the Arrival Day off!
Although there's loads of packages to deliver, everyone tells me that I should be spending the day with someone special instead.
So I thought it over for a bit, and um... I thought I'd like to spend this day with you.
I'm so thankful to have come to this world and made friends with folks like you and Iris. Well... I mean, I still have the cake Iris gave me—do you want to have some with me?

6025.mail_desc:
Admin, thank you for coming to make the cake with me...
You've no idea how happy I was when you praised my baking skills. Of course, at the end of the day I'm just an amateur baker.
And I want to say... I used to cause so much trouble to you all. Thank goodness you managed to find me in the Imago Room back then!
Yes, one has to face the truth... But having said that, I'm still unsure of myself when I'm not around you and the others.
Seeing how good you are at your work and at taking care of others, Admin, I'm also inspired to work harder... to be able to stand by your side one day.
Um... the fall here in Ain Soph can get a little chilly, so I've made you a scarf and a pair of gloves.
Please, if there's anything I can help you with, Admin, just let me know.

6026.mail_desc:
Did you just wish me a happy Arrival Day? The audacity of you, Admin.
But I'm curious to know: where does this courage of yours come from? Hmm? Did Osiris put you up to this?
Pfft... Cat got your tongue?
Fine, whatever. It's laudable that a human like you is paying respects to my power on this special day, so I'll indulge you.
You may regard this letter as an invitation. Just don't expect me to welcome you with noisy fanfare the way Osiris does.
Remember, when you're before me on this special day, you're not to mumble to yourself like a stubborn fool.
Just say something nice, and keep me happy.

6027.mail_desc:
Good morrow, Admin! (Hmm, Lady Hera tells me that this is a courteous greeting that was used back in the day. Does it make you happy when I use that?)
Leuce and Mintha have been busy all morning... But when I ask them what they're doing, they don't tell me a thing about it. Hades is also skulking around in an unusual manner... Well... I'm starting to feel sleepy but... No, I can't.
Had Drowsie not shown me the calendar, I might've just slept through my Arrival Day this year...
When... was the last time we saw each other? (Although to be honest I do see you quite often in my dreams, Admin...)
You're always so busy with work... and have no time for yourself, let alone... me.
I hear that today... Leuce and Mintha plan to bake me a cake. As you know, they make really good desserts and... I'm sure any cake they make will be even better...
So, will you come celebrate my Arrival Day with me? I'll be at... the lobby of the Society of Muses. I hope to see you when I open my eyes, Admin.

6028.mail_desc:
Huh? My Arrival Day? Where did you hear that from...? Must be... Hmph. He sure likes sticking his nose into other folks' business.
But thanks for the good wishes anyway.
I know what you want to say, but I'm not gonna respond to that. I am pleased with my life right now, and I'm also working towards my long-held goal.
You and I, though we'll never agree on some things...
Let's get together again when all this is over. We'll have the best booze in Rostach and meat by the platefuls, and we'll arm-wrestle till the sun comes up!
What a party it'll be!

6029.mail_desc:
Dear Admin, I hope this finds you well. This is Ganglati.
I wish Miss Hel could see the expression on your face as you're reading this. It'd make her so happy.
Alright, let's skip the niceties and get to business. I hope you've remembered that today's Miss Hel's Arrival Day, and that you've come up with a gift commensurate with Miss Hel's status.
If you're ready, then please show up on time at her Arrival Day party tonight.
Please understand that this is not my idea but Miss Hel's. I'm simply the messenger since she won't say her wishes out loud.
Oh, one more thing: Miss Hel says she's very... <System Reminder> Reboot Complete...
Ganglati. Too chatty. Don't listen to it...
You may come or not... Anyway... I'll save a place for you. That's all.

6030.mail_desc:
Admin, I wonder what the weather is like where you are? The weather forecast says it'll snow here in Ain Soph next week... Hope you can get back just in time to see the first snow of the year.
Everyone's been looking forward to throwing an Arrival Day party for me, though I'm not sure if that'd take up too much of their time... So, I decided to invite everyone to that steak restaurant I like, to try out their new menu offerings as a celebration instead.
Although I haven't seen you much lately, I'm still happy that I can help you out with my intel...
I haven't open that present you gave me yet... Just want to keep the mystery a little longer. I'm guessing there's a great music CD in there? Thank you so much.
When you're back, how about we listen to this CD together in the dorm? I'll get ready some comfy cushions and hot tea for you, along with a nice, warm throw.
What do you think?

6031.mail_desc:
With all this white everywhere, it must mean that the Winter Festival is upon us again.
Actually, my Arrival Day is also on the same day, which is why this is usually a rather lively time of the year for me, as it's almost as if everybody is celebrating for me, too. (I'm not proud of having this thought.)
This year, Stellaris Academy is holding an ice sculpture exhibition against the backdrop of its gorgeous winterscape, and I hear that the works are all created by the teachers at the Department of Sculpture.
You know, the idea of a fairy tale world full of ice and snow is fascinating, and I can show you around if you're here. But you're probably too busy at work, so let's meet up next time you are free.
However, I've created this album of pictures of the Winter Festival I've taken around the academy over three days.
A little incident to share with you: it was snowing heavily when I completed the album. I left the album by the window, and by the time I came back from the kitchen it was covered with snowflakes.
That is why I then chose to call it the White Album. I hope you'll love the look of Stellaris Academy during the Winter Festival as much as I do after looking through it.

6032.mail_title: The Time I've Spent With You
6032.mail_desc:
The calendar tells me that my Arrival Day is coming around again.
To me, occasions like this have become rather unimportant over time. However, I... still remember a friend from back then and how excited he'd get at this time. The first few years, he would urge me to cut the cake and say to me his signature blessings: "May your inspiration never die".
So, as time went by, I got used to the idea of celebrating Arrival Day. It's not the cake that interests me, though. It's just that on this day each year, I like to indulge in a little bit of sculpting work.
As I look back on the past year, I keep thinking about the time I've spent with you. So, I'd like to invite you to join me here in Omorfies as I work on my sculpture of the year.
Time flows like water. As my carving knife slides across the plaster, what was previously elusive takes tangible form; no matter how much time has passed, there're always certain moments I want to retain forever.
Especially since... you've been in many of them this year.

6033.mail_desc:
Relax, Admin. This has nothing to do with work, and I'm writing this invite in my personal capacity.
I was tidying up and going through my things over New Year's when I came across an old planner in which I'd written several to-dos outside of work. At first I thought this must be a planner I used when I first started working (I was still a novice in categorizing back then), and it was only when I started flipping through its pages that I realized it was just a personal notebook.
All these things I had wanted to do all seem so foreign to me now. I've been so busy with my duties at Aether Gazer all this time that I've forgotten most of them.
As it's my Arrival Day today, Poseidon and Osiris have bundled me out of my office for the day, saying that they'll help me with my work.
The thing is, I'm not sure what I should do with myself now that I've left the office, except maybe visit the coffeehouse and the bookstore, two places I've listed in my notebook.
I thought about it, and I'd like to visit them with you, Admin. I wonder if you're interested in coming with me?
I'll see you in a bit at Aether Gazer's lobby.

6034.mail_desc:
Rookie... Ahem, I mean, Administrator—You didn't really believe that I'd forget what day it is today?
Heh, it suddenly occurred to me that you've already outgrown your old nickname. This past year, you led the Modifiers of Aether Gazer around the world solving one crisis after another, and you performed excellently in your cooperation with Modifiers from other Sephirah Zones. Lots of people have been singing your praises to Director Odin lately!
Mature and reliable, you've become the "General Office's trump card." In countless thrilling battles, you've formed deep bonds with Modifiers from all over. Outside of battle, you've managed to bring perfect order to your hectic schedule. You're even able to get along with all sorts of different types of Modifiers! It's hard to imagine what Division Nine would be like without you...
Glug, glug, glug... I've requested special leave for you today—paid leave, in fact! Hehe, you're welcome! (If you want to thank me, bring me some cola-flavored Coolant next time—make that a large.) The world is full of holidays, but today's is yours alone. So, leave your work at your desk and go out and celebrate!
In conclusion, on behalf of everyone at Aether Gazer, allow me to say... Happy Birthday, Administrator!

6035.mail_desc:
I received your card and gift. You chose well, I commend your taste in style.
With the new year fast approaching, the Valleyrand Family and Division Three have had even more matters to attend to. If it weren't for your reminder, I may very well have forgotten my own Arrival Day again.
I've never believed in the necessity of spending time on such things, but perhaps you're correct—sometimes taking a rest can better prepare one for the work that lies ahead.
Once our work has wrapped up, I'll arrange a time. I hope you'll be able to join me then. This has nothing to do with business. I'm simply extending the invitation as a friend.
There's nothing to be uneasy about either, it will just be an ordinary family dinner. I'm sure that Mr. Hoenir and Edward will also be pleased to see you.
As for pre-meal activities, I believe it's time we picked up our last game of chess where we left off.

6036.mail_desc:
Dear Admin, thank you for thinking of me. I've been well.
New Year's is almost here again, and folks all over Xu Heng have begun to prepare for the festival celebrations. It all feels very different from the rest of the year! If you're free, you should come to Xu Heng to check it out. Just let me know when you're coming, and I will take some time off to accompany you. It's also been very busy at the Quad, but everyone was kind enough to celebrate my Arrival Day. Today, I received many good wishes, followed by questions about what the celebration would be like. It sounds a little odd, but this really got me in the mood, and I quite liked it, actually.
Whenever I talk about Arrival Day, I feel rather distant from it, and I don't know how to respond to everyone's good wishes. They often say that this is a day worth celebrating, for this marks the continuation of life and bears testimony to growth over the year just past. What I remember most clearly, however, is the first time, the real "Arrival Day," which was also the day when catastrophe had struck Gaea. If the world had never needed me, maybe it would be worthy of everyone's celebration... Only on Arrival Day would I feel so sorry.
We came into this world with the responsibility of protecting life, and all we've to show for it after all these years is this unfinished business. Fortunately, there's always someone by my side, helping me do the things I can't do and understand the true meaning of perseverance. I hope that someday in the future, both Gaea and we can usher in a new life and the true continuation and growth of civilization.
I wish you lasting peace and contentment.

6037.mail_desc:
It's my Arrival Day today. I don't quite get what that means, but I do know that on this day each year, Leviathan would put a pointy hat on my head and wish me a happy Arrival Day.
I've seen how the others spend their Arrival Day. Everyone gets together and eats a lot of nice food. Maybe... Arrival Day is just like a festival day?
I understand what a "festival" is: it's when everyone comes together on the same day to celebrate something. What I don't get is, what is it that we're celebrating on Arrival Day?
I think I'm just going to settle for "a special day that everyone has for themselves"... for now.
Anyway, it's my Arrival Day today, and I... would like to invite you to have a fun day out with me, and have lots and lots of meat together, meat I brought back from the pole. It's perfect for a day like this.
I've learned how to sing that Happy Arrival Day song Leviathan always sings... I'll sing it for you on your special day, Admin.

6038.mail_desc:
It's been a while, my little lamb.
Miss me a little, maybe? Or perhaps you miss Leuce and Mintha, my lovely dolls, even more?
Do give me an honest answer, or else... Haha, relax. I'll give you a break here. But I do have something to ask of you regarding the two of them.
Every year, it's always them who get everything perfectly arranged for my Arrival Day celebration, and I've been wanting to do something for them instead.
So this year, I want to do something different, like take them on a drive to the Stellaris Sea coastline or some such. And of course, we're going in my car!
And since I'm taking them, I might as well include you too, my little lamb. Wanna feel the wind in my limited-edition, 1,500-horsepower sports car on a route specially designed by yours truly? Surely you won't decline this exciting invitation?

6039.mail_desc:
Hey Admin, it's been a while! Do you miss me?
I've finished reading the book you recommended the last time we worked together, and tried to use what I learned from the book in my work. Guess what? My peers told me I've made great progress recently! I have you to thank for this!
Time really flies, and we're looking at the start of a new year again. I really hope that when CORG works with you again I'll get to join forces with you. I'm sure this better me will ease your burden!
Remember you said that you wanted to see me dance? In fact, every year on my Arrival Day, I hold a solo dance for myself as a tiny ritual.
This year... I want to invite someone special that I'm grateful to. Not just to watch me dance, but to also dance with me, and create some memories together. I've already come up with a dance duet for that, and the steps are really easy.
Would you like to have a dance with me, Admin?

6040.mail_desc:
Hey! Where were you on this important day of mine, sweetie?
I can't believe I have to spend tonight all by my lonesome! How about... you tell me where you'll be tonight, and I'll come to you? As you know, I can get pretty stealthy, so no one's gonna find us out...
Haha! Fine, fine, I'll stop. I'm in a good mood today—I stopped by the wine store and bought myself something. They tell me that it's really highly rated. Why don't we sample it together when you're back?
I've an idea: if there's snowfall when you drop by, we can admire the snow and soak in a hot spring together, you and I... And then would you also rub my back for me? I've been on all these missions lately and really need a bit of help.
Drop by when you're free. I'll be waiting for you...

6041.mail_title: Let's Have Another Great Year Together!
6041.mail_desc:
It's New Year again, Admin!
So much has happened in the past year, and happy or sad, you've always been right by my side.
As long as you're with me, nothing seems impossible.
ANYWAY. It's my Arrival Day today, and although we used to celebrate it over barbecue... I'd like to do something different this year.
Let's go on a trip somewhere! On our missions, we've gone past so many scenic places. I've done a little research and it appears that Spring Gardens and Dragonridge Hill are both very well-known sights in Xu Heng. But honestly, I'll be happy to go anywhere with you.
And when we're done with the sightseeing, I'll have you try the cake I made myself, and you'll take up the most important task of singing me the Arrival Day song!
Let's have another great year together, Admin!

6042.mail_title: Waiting for You in the Spring Air
6042.mail_desc:
Hello, Admin. This is an invitation.
I stopped by Sophora Garden to tend to the plants after I got back from my business trip yesterday. Some of the late-blooming plum blossoms haven't fallen yet, but there are already some new sprouts dotting the trees, and new grass is poking its way out of the soil.
I always found winters unbearably long when I was little, but there would always come a day when I'd look up from my work and see a few shoots of green among the withered leaves. It was comforting to me, knowing that even though I was shivering cold at the moment, winter was on its way out.
There's something to see in the garden every season, but because of those memories, I find this season particularly special. The snow is beginning to melt and green is starting to reappear. I know the trees and flowers aren't growing for any specific person, but still... I'd like to share all this beauty and these memories with you.
Also, today's my Arrival Day. Linyu keeps track of it even better than I do—not that I could forget it even if I wanted to, given that she starts preparing for it weeks in advance. I've had this invitation ready for a while. Just been waiting for the right time to give it to you.
Linyu and I prepared tea for three at Sophora Garden. Your cup is waiting for you.

6043.mail_desc:
Evening, Admin! Feels like this sea voyage is taking forever... Maybe because you're not here with me? I mean, because you always tell me such interesting stories! Yeah, that must be the reason...
Anyway, I'll be reaching my destination in a few hours and taking in the beautiful vistas of Cape Mysteria soon.
The special fishsticks you concocted for me will go perfectly with the beautiful sunrise—I'll make sure the seagulls don't carry them off this time.
It kind of sucks you won't be here to celebrate my Arrival Day with me. Still, eating a tasty snack and watching the sunrise isn't the worst way to spend it.
Let's plan a trip next time we're both free, one long enough to see all the places we want to!
It's a promise, Admin.

6044.mail_title: A Spring Date at the Beach
6044.mail_desc:
Right as I opened your Arrival Day card, a slight breeze blew across my face, almost as if the wind were carrying the warmth of your well-wishes to me.
I know we see each other at Aether Gazer all the time, but I like the feeling of talking through letters like this. It feels like here I can say all the things I usually can't manage to.
I made a necklace using the shells I found last time I went to the beach. I think it'd be a nice thank-you gift. Hope you like it.
You know, I had a thought while I was making it. When people think of the beach, it's always about summer, but the ocean is also lovely in the spring. It's not that wild now, but there's a certain charm in its quietness. It's just... I feel like I would be lonely if I went to see it by myself.You often say I always think of what other people want—that I never take the time to think of what I want. Well... Admin, would you go take a walk down the beach with me, on this special day?

6045.mail_desc:
Hey, long time no see, Admin. Been doing okay?
Today's my Arrival Day... I think. I don't remember exactly. Maybe it's been too long since I really paid attention to it.
One thing I can say for sure, though, is that I feel lucky to see another spring.
When I was with the Karasugo, all I thought about every day was when death would come for me—right until someone came and rescued me from within those walls. When I got out, I saw the rolling hills covered in spring flowers, stretching towards all directions before me. That was the first time I felt truly grateful for being alive.
Ah, seems like I'm rambling a bit. What I'm trying to say is, I'm thinking of how I want to celebrate my Arrival Day, but I'm drawing blanks. I think... (A long line is scratched into the letter here, as if the writer tried to completely erase the second half of the sentence.)
Never mind. Better just not to worry about unimportant things like this.
Anyway, spring is here. Want to go look at the flowers together?

6046.mail_desc:
Are you surprised that you're getting an invitation to a fight instead of a party?
Don't tell me you forgot what happened last year, my partner in crime! I couldn't believe that, out of everyone, only you escaped the prank unscathed. You have NO idea what a huge blow that was to me!
You know what they say: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again!" That's where the fun begins, no?
So, for my Arrival Day party this year, I'm gonna get everyone who lost last time to fight against YOU, Admin!
That said, since you're my partner in crime, I'm gonna give you a little helping hand... I've written down a strategy for you on the back of this letter. Take a very good look at it!
I can't wait to see what the results will be this year! I can be pretty tough when I want to be, you know!
I worked really hard to put this all together, so no flaking out on me, got it?!

6047.mail_desc:
Almost every year, I've spent my Arrival Day in battle. It's often weeks before I remember to check my mailbox and see all the gifts everyone sent me.
You helped me realize just how much everyone wants to celebrate with me. That's why I immediately sent over this comms request.
Seeing everyone come together just to celebrate my Arrival Day, I... can't help but try to finish up my mission as quickly as possible. Just two more days, and I'll be back to see you all!
Ahem. That's what you taught me, right? You should tell the people you care about most everything that's on your mind.
When I think about the countless battles we've fought together, I realize that the reason I can give it my all is because I know you've always got my back.
Thank you, Admin, for showing me how special my Arrival Day really is.
Keep an eye out for my next message! As soon as my missions are all wrapped up, I'll return to you in a flash.

6048.mail_desc:
Hey, Admin. Thanks for the gift you sent me—I've been wanting to get my hands on that old record for a while now.
When we celebrated my Arrival Day last year, you expressed an interest in Rostach wine. If you have the time, why don't you come check out our Brewers Festival?
I say "festival"—I suppose "mini bazaar" would be a more accurate description. On that day, everyone brings out all sorts of homemade brews and handicrafts to sell. The kids call these little critters made from scrap metal "brewer fairies"—it's pretty funny.
Don't worry, plenty of the drinks are a new sort that you can drink without getting silly. You won't find that outside of Rostach!
Once you've got a time in mind, let me know. I'll be waiting for you in the usual spot at the Akkadian Guild.

6049.mail_desc:
Don't forget, Admin, you'll lose your glow if you don't get a proper amount of rest.
You've been so engrossed in work recently, I've even seen you sleeping at your desk on more than one occasion. Industriousness may be a laudable quality, but neglecting to rest is counterproductive.
Today is an especially important day—the sun's Arrival Day. As it so happens, I received my performance wages from the opera house the other day, so I ordered some tea party desserts from Omorfies and organized a concert at a restaurant.
As the star of the show, I'll be putting on a splendid show for everyone, in which my kind, warm light will wash away everyone's weariness.
Naturally, I've reserved the best seat in the house for you. Your shining sun patiently awaits your arrival.

6050.mail_desc:
It's almost my Arrival Day again, which means I'll get to eat longevity noodles again!
Do you still remember what they taste like, Admin? ...Er, though the last time I had longevity noodles, I ate them so fast I forgot to leave any for you... But the bowl of soup we shared afterwards was still nice, right?
I actually asked the chef several times if he could make an exception and bring us two bowls, but in the end, there was nothing I could say to make him flout the "special significance of longevity noodles."
But where there's a will, there's a way. Since I'm writing to you now, naturally that means I've found a way.
After asking around, I got the recipe for longevity noodles, and I've even gathered the ingredients so we can make a big bowl to share. What do you think?
Rest assured, after living a life of solitude for so many years, I've honed my culinary skills to perfection!
...Though if anything goes wrong, we can always return to the Quad.

6051.mail_desc:
It's so hot again today I don't want to go out. So I'm sending this message instead.
A few days ago, you asked what my plans for my Arrival Day are. I didn't come up with any, so I'll leave that to you. Anything would be fine. Just don't make me go outside.
I drew the upright Empress card this morning, and you'll be here, so I think we'll have fun whatever we decide to do. And you better give me my present then. If you pretend like you forgot to bring it, you dropped it in the sea, or BunBun-3 crushed it... you can spend my Arrival Day with BunBun-3 instead.
That said, I've already prepared a thank-you gift for you, and just like we agreed last time... I'll save one Arrival Day wish for you. I won't tell you what it is, though—not this year, next year, the year after, or even in a hundred years... So, you'll just have to stick with me until then.
That reminds me—when you do come over, don't forget to bring the "BunBun Mobile Home for Two" drawing I left in your room. You've forgotten it every single time... not that it's your fault.
The desserts I ordered will be here soon. I'll be here waiting for you.

6052.mail_desc:
Thank you for your message, Admin. I saw it first thing this morning, and it has definitely brightened my day.
I came across this really nice place outside while on a mission a while ago. The scenery there was stunning, and there was such a nice breeze. I almost fell asleep while I was resting there, heh heh.
However... though the scenery was beautiful, I felt it was such a pity that I was the only one enjoying it. It would have been better if you'd been there, too.
Since I happen to be going to Ain Soph soon, why don't you join me on a trip to that spot? Pack some things and meet me at the Photon Rail station. I'll take care of everything else, and I guarantee the trip will be worth your while.
Be there or be square, Admin!

6053.mail_desc:
Arrival Day... I only learned what this term meant after I came to Aether Gazer.
However, when I was back at the pole, sometimes there would be sunlight all day, and sometimes there would be none at all, so I often couldn't keep track of the days. It would have been pointless for me to know what Arrival Day is back then!
But you know, you can only see the aurora at the poles, and it's so beautiful!
It has all sorts of colors: the shades of milk tea and matcha ice cream, and even the hue of Master's hair... It really is stunning!
How about you come see the aurora with me some time, Admin? But first, you have to promise that you'll take lots and lots of great pictures for me!

6054.mail_title: Waiting for You at the Training Ground.
6054.mail_desc:
Another year has passed. I've already done a thorough cleaning of the training room just in case you come by again this year.
With all of my day-to-day duties and training, I very rarely have any time to myself. While I have no idea what I want to do, my first instinct is to spend the day with you somehow. I think even just chatting over tea would be fine.
Oh, by the way, I went out today and managed to get the dango I told you about last time... But wait—I forgot about the tea!
Sorry Admin, but I have to stop my note here and head out again.
Admin... you're coming, aren't you? If you do, I'll meet you at the usual spot.

6055.mail_desc:
I've received the folding fan you sent. The painting on it is really beautiful... Thank you.
Actually, I never thought that I'd receive a gift from you, Questioner. It's been a long time since Arrival Day has meant anything to me, perhaps.
So I'm not sure how to describe my feelings to you now... But since my mother told me before that emotions are embedded in music, I'll record all my thoughts right now in the score.
You always say that you'd like to hear me play the ryūteki. I wonder if you can tell how I'm feeling from the music?
It's a deal, Questioner. I'll be waiting for you. Think of it as... my Arrival Day wish.

6056.mail_desc:
I'm sorry for the late reply—I was on a mission earlier today.
I've received the dumbbells you sent back to me, though it looks like you didn't use them much. Is it because I didn't clearly explain how to use them, or were you too busy? I may have to replace your fitness equipment at this rate...
However, since you've already returned the dumbbells, it's also time I fulfilled my promise. I've not forgotten your invitation from last year.
I've already made a reservation at a restaurant, which is right next to CORG's headquarters. If need be, I can pick you up in a company car.

6057.mail_desc:
Admiiiiin! How have you been? I miss you so much!!!
You remember what day it is today, don't you? Yes, yes, it's my Arrival Day! My Arrival Day!
Master has granted me leave from Ruomu Palace for the day and even given me these pretty blue things, which she says I can use to buy myself delicious food.
So I followed my nose and came to this shop with all these yummy smells coming from it, and I gave them all of the little blue things I had on me.
Then, I'm not sure why, but they gave me lots and lots of yummy food. I've been working really hard at finishing it all, but I still can't seem to manage.
My gut instinct is telling me that there's a food Yaoguai in my stomach that's making me so full, I can't even walk. I'm sure it's going wreak havoc on the world later on.
But I'll never allow something like that to happen! So then I thought of you, Admin. You'll come help me deal with the food demon as soon as you read this, right?
Hurry, hurry—I'm waiting for you!

6058.mail_desc:
Dear Admin, it's a while. I hope this message finds you well!
I only realized what occasion it is today after receiving Arrival Day wishes from a patient of mine. But I don't plan to take the rest of the day off today. I've been treating patients for years, after all, and I'm used to it. Besides, it's been as busy as ever at Vermilion Wellness today. But I'll make an Arrival Day wish, which is that the world will not experience any more suffering!
I've been thinking about how you mentioned last time that you've been under a lot of stress. I think you should definitely take some herbs. Since you're busy at work, I've taken the liberty of putting together a decoction for you, which should arrive with this note. All you have to do is to boil it in water and take one dose a day. Of course, I've tweaked the formula so it shouldn't be too bitter this time. Having said that, while this formula can improve your bodily functions, if you continue to experience issues, you should seek medical treatment as soon as possible.
Mmm... How about this. If you have some free time, Admin, give me some advance notice and I'll head over to Ain Soph to help you. Given the specifics of your condition, I think it's best that I come myself. Besides, I'm already familiar with your health... Since you're doing crucial work, low mood and overwork may be unavoidable. Even so, I hope you'll be able to take care of yourself. You may leave the rest to me.

6059.mail_desc:
It's been a long time since we last talked, Admin. I hope things have been going well for you over at Aether Gazer!
I've been wanting to write you for some time now, but there's been a lot of heavy rain here recently and I've been so busy working on repairing the facilities on Meruism's perimeter, I forgot.
In fact, I only opened my Arrival Day gift moments ago, and what a surprise it was! I can't believe that you remembered how fond I am of this spice... You must have spent a lot of time to get ahold of it! I'll treat you to some food the next time you're in Gar!
You have no idea how much I've missed this spice. I had a bottle of it before Brahmā brought me to Meruism, and I'd take a sniff of it whenever my hunger was too much to bear and imagine using it on all sorts of delicious food. Heh—it sounds a little weird now, doesn't it?
Jokes aside, the spice does perk you up, and taking it as a tea rightbefore combat can be helpful. I can send you the recipe right now if you're interested.
Although I wasn't able to celebrate my Arrival Day with you, we can still mark the occasion by sharing a cup of the same tea at the same time, can't we?

6060.mail_desc:
Good evening, Admin. This is the only time of the day I can send you a message because the store has been busy, busy, busy!!!
Remember how you told me I'd totally "feel it in my bones" in this job? How everything is going to be pure muscle and power? And how it'd be "hit after hit after hit"...?
You got me so excited about this job...
I.... Why didn't you tell me before you recommended it to me that it's actually a fast food restaurant specializing in hamburgers???
And my coworkers are always making funny noises while hammering the meat patties with their hands, and they even said called me small and weak! Hmph, I bet if there was a competition in the store now, my meat hammer would be the fastest.
But I must still thank you, Admin. For now, thanks to you, I get to have the all-you-can-eat staff meals here, and I've almost earned enough money for the competition next month.
I've already booked your Photon Rail ticket, so remember to come and watch my game!

6061.mail_desc:
I'm writing to let you know that your gift arrived here at the Society of Muses on time.
The packaging was far too basic, by the way. No aesthetic and unworthy of your kind intent. I can see I'm going to have to find the time to impress upon you the value of beauty and good manners...
That said, the gift itself was quite tasteful. You must have put a lot of thought into it and I can see all my efforts in tutoring you have not gone to waste. I like it.
Although... Well, obviously you should mark my Arrival Day, but any gift deserves something in return.
I'm sure you've heard of the divine tea parties we have in Omorfies? The finest delicacies, the loveliest music, and of course the best tea ever. It'll just be the two of us, so I do hope you can find the time. And don't worry about my travels. I only have one Arrival Day a year, so I should spend it doing something special with someone important.
I'm enclosing an invitation and hope to see you here, at the Society of Muses, on my Arrival Day.

6062.mail_desc:
Admin, I got your gift! Thanks so much for remembering, I'm so busy I forgot all about it. Ha ha!
And in exchange for wishing me a Happy Arrival Day, I'll wish you riches and fortune!
There's no greater blessing in Xu Heng, you know.
Hey, I remember you said things weren't going too well for you financially? If you want, I could find you a job here? Maybe you'll like it!
Nah, only kidding! Have to admit though, your situation is a new one to me... Tell you what, download Tian Lu Traders' new app, Bustling Business, and tap on the Knack for Business class, then follow us.
We publish short lessons on financial management every week, teaching everyone how to manage their money and make it work for them.
I'm not going to claim it'll mean financial freedom after one lesson, we're just explaining that there's more to do with your money than simply saving it. Investments, that kind of thing, and the associated risks and rewards.
And it's free, obviously, but we appreciate it if you repost or favorite anything you find useful.
Not that it's advertising for us, of course! Oh, almost forgot. I've booked a table at a restaurant here, you must remember to come.

6063.mail_title: Come make sushi cake with us!
6063.mail_desc:
Hey, Aether Gazer, how have you been since we last met? I got your gift!
Got to admit, I thought only the Ninja Irregulars would remember my Arrival Day. I mean, you know how the locals here are SO scared of me. They probably wish I had a Leaving Day, not an Arrival Day, ha!
I think you are the only people who'll be celebrating.
Previously, I just used to eat soba noodles with the Irregulars for my Arrival Day. Maybe with some extra fried oysters or shrimp. It's not like it was a feast or anything big, but it kinda marked the day, y'know.
But this year is different, because I got a gift from you! That means I have to play the host to show my gratitude and treat you! The Irregulars want to make a sushi cake this year. I sneaked in to have a look at the ingredients they've collected: tempura, salmon, wasabi octopus, everything! With so much to eat, there's got to be something you'll like, huh?
So... do you want to come and help them make the sushi cake? It'll be fun, and you get to eat the food made with your own hands, and that's always the tastiest. And... And I guess I'd like to taste something made with Aether Gazer's very own hands. It would be like...
No, wait! It wouldn't! I've said enough. Anyway, you will come, won't you, Aether Gazer?

6064.mail_desc:
Let me guess what you thought when you saw the message notification?
An unexpected task to do? A surprise holiday? Or something that would let you try your luck with the Scanning System?
Sorry, all of those answers are incorrect. It's my Arrival Day, that's all.
I can't recall what I've done on this day in the past. Tracked down fugitive criminals? Had a big long nap? Nothing worth remembering, anyway. But when I got up this morning and saw the date, I felt like I shouldn't let the day pass unnoticed. After all, now I can use it as an excellent excuse for a day off, right?
So, I'm having a party!
Or I thought I would. Problem is, who to invite? And what to do?
The first person I thought of, Admin, was you. Don't bother asking why, just tell me if you're free or not.
The chances are it'll just be me and you, eating a cake and instant noodles. But I'm sure you won't mind wasting an evening with me.
Hey, maybe now I should start calling it my birthday, not my Arrival Day, like humans do?
Still sounds good to me!

6065.mail_desc:
So sorry, Admin! We've had some electrical problems at the Hearth of Danu and I was so busy working on them that I almost missed your Arrival Day message. I hope it's not too late to say thanks.
Anyway, the repairs were a good chance to give the workshop a good top-to-bottom cleaning. I found lots of old things I made, so it was a nostalgic process.
One of them was a speed-chopping assistant mecha. Put it on and you can chop ten different ingredients at once! Very practical if you want to open a restaurant!
Another was a kind of frame you can put fishing rods on and it alerts you if any of them catch a fish, so you can have a dozen or more rods working at once. But I don't know anyone who goes fishing, so it was never used.
Oh, and another was a bed-car? Or a car-bed? Anyway, it is a bed with wheels, and you can steer it in any direction you want. It can turn on the spot, even. You can go off-road racing in it!
Anyway, I found lots of things like those. I thought about giving you a few to say thanks, but I wasn't sure if you'd like any of them... Oh, there was a mechanical heart, which was the first thing I made after I returned to work. I've always believed that people and machines can find a way to co-exist, and so used my skills with technology to help those in need. It's a beautiful feeling, when I see someone living their best life because of something I've made. I hope I'll be able to help you too.
Oh, I know! I could convert it into a small clock. It'd be perfect for keeping time! And if you like the sound of any of those other things I mentioned, do tell me and I'll bring those for you too.

630501.mail_desc:
Hey Admin! Long time no see. Thanks for the letter and gift.
Ash wants me to say hello from him, too. And let me tell you, there aren't many people that he deigns to say hello to! It must be because he likes that mane brush you sent him so much, huh?
You know, this day last year you came to Omorfies just to spend my Arrival Day with me. I remember it as if it was yesterday. You mentioned in the letter you're still grateful for my performance of Sea of Stars. Well, I'm the one who should be saying thanks.
Because that was when I got back into my cello playing! I had neglected it for ages. After coming home at night, I no longer find myself staring at it in the glass cabinet. But now all I need to do is think of the attentive audience I had that night and the bow comes alive in my hand.
Oh, I wish I had the words to express how grateful I feel. If I have the chance, I'd love to play for you again. But only if you're willing to listen, Admin.

630502.mail_desc:
I've received the book you sent me... Thank you. But how did you know that it's my Arrival Day today? Did you hear it from that blabbermouth Linyu again???
... I'm not mad at you or anything. It's just that it feels a little... incredible to receive a gift from you.
I might not have remembered this occasion myself today had it not been for your well wishes, and I can't believe that you also remembered that I was in need of this book!
How am I supposed to... No, no, no, let's stick to the important matters first.
Regarding the question you asked me earlier, I'm done sorting the relevant data. You may also want to know that we're beginning to see results in the joint experimental project with the Cryptics, and we should see some data from that too soon.
The only problem is, I'm a little busy these days and won't be able to find the time to travel to Ain Soph. Would you come to Shuofang Isle instead in that case?
... Now, don't you dare let your thoughts wander! I'm only asking you to come because I feel that it's better to hand you the files in person. Besides, I... and Lingguang, and Linyu, and the rest, we haven't seen you in a while. We're all looking forward to seeing you here in Xu Heng.
Anyway, remember to come see me on Shuofang Isle. We can catch up on the rest when you're here!
Ta-ta.

630503.mail_desc:
Admin, I'm sure you've already guessed why I'm writing, so I won't beat around the bush.
I'd like you to attend my celebratory dinner tonight. You don't need to do anything or bring anything, just turn up on time.
It'll only be the two of us. As you know I'm not exactly the social type, so you're the only invitee. After all, researchers have found it's not the quantity of attendees at these events that's important, it's the quality. Get the right people and the desired emotional effects will follow. Anyway, what I'm trying to say is... I hope you can make it.
Oh, and while I'm writing: I've written up my recent experimental findings into a paper and submitted it for publication. The feedback is looking good, and it confirms the feasibility of using dopamine to promote efficiency. Of course, I do need more data so tonight's meal will involve a little bit of work in amongst all the play. I'm sure you won't mind helping out, Admin.
Okay, see you tonight!

630504.mail_desc:
Admin, it's been a while!
I've been all over the place since temporarily leaving Aether Gazer. But whenever I stop to practice, I find myself thinking of you and Pheasant Squad. Of fighting with you all, shoulder to shoulder, and of daily life back at Aether Gazer. I've found lots of fascinating chess records and tasty snacks on my travels and sent them back to HQ. Hope you like them!
I still haven't found who I'm looking for or done what I need to do. But I know there are important people behind me, as well as somewhere off in front.
You know, I only realized my Arrival Day was today, when I was flicking through my calendar yesterday. It's a half-moon, which isn't as bright or romantic as a full moon, but it's enough to light the path between friends, I think.
I'm sending this on my way back to Aether Gazer.
Hope to see you as the moon rises!

630505.mail_desc:
Yoohoo, Admin! Thanks for the canned food! Thanks to you I was fully fueled for my mission and I beat the other guys good and proper! Bossman said our coffers are overflowing, though I'm not sure what a coffer is or if I even have one... Anyways, everyone's happy!
Bossman also said something about it being my "birthday" soon and gave me some spending cash to buy whatever I want.
I'm not sure what a birthday is, but whatever, I figure I should eat and drink to celebrate it!
So, I'm holding a Crazy-Croco-Bash!
Hehe, Pops taught me to stick "crazy" on the start of words. Makes them sound WAY cooler!
Bossman also said parties need a crowd to be fun, and I thought of you right away! I've got lots of crazy things ready: canned peas, black bread, blue cheese... piles and piles of stuff!
So remember, don't miss my Crazy-Croco-Bash!

630601.mail_desc:
I got the present you sent me, Admin! But next time don't pay so much for the express service, huh? It was a fun surprise but it'll be so much cheaper if I just come and pick it up in person.
But I think I understand why you went to so much expense. You must have been as excited to send it as I was to open it, right?
Hehe, I'm right, I know. Anyway, thank you so much, Admin. I was so happy to get your gift!
Work wasn't too busy today, so Iris gave me the day off. I was going to chillax at home, but I couldn't sit still and came out for a wander.
And guess what? I wandered all the way to your building! I won't come up and bother you though, as I'm sure you're working hard.
But if you get this and you're free, do you want to come down and join me? You can't stay healthy sitting at your desk day after day.
We can... go to my place! It's not far, maybe 15 kilometers. I'm having an Arrival Day meal there this evening!
Oh, and don't worry too much. If you really can't manage the distance I can offer a door-to-door delivery service!

630701.mail_desc:
Thank you for taking the time out from your busy schedule to get these for me, Admin!
And you really went out of your way, Admin, contacting everyone at Aether Gazer on the terminal so that I can have "a feel of what it's like to be at Aether Gazer"... And I received so many gifts, too. I have all these boxes stacked so high everywhere in my room at the moment.
Believe me when I say that I can feel everyone's love from here. After all, I've only gotten to where I am today thanks to the care I've enjoyed from everyone, including you, Admin...
I'll never forget all the moments we've had together along the way, be it the challenges we've faced side by side or the moment when I finally stood tall next to you...
Therefore, when I celebrate Arrival Day, I also think of several other things: my responsibilities and my commitment to the things I have to safeguard and protect, as well as my relationships with others...
How about you take a day off today, Admin? The cake is ready and will be brought to you soon.
I'll keep on working hard! Please continue guiding me, and I promise you won't be disappointed!

630702.mail_desc:
Did I not tell you last year not to waste time on what you call "well wishes for me, and only me"? Or that any such actions by you would only cause me to feel inconvenienced?
If you imagined doing this would make me happy, you're more foolishly obsequious that I thought. You, Ver, and Osiris... I detest that cheeky smile you people always have on your faces! It's so very tiresome!
Why make such a fuss? Just treat today as any other day. Or does it please you to defy me?
Ugh! Just thinking about that shameless look on your face infuriates me. Since you want a gift in return that much, I'll satisfy you just once in view of the occasion. Take this. But know that if you ever lose it or break it, you won't ever get a second one.
Just whose Arrival Day are we celebrating today anyway?!
Listen carefully. Even on a day like today, my gift to you is not for you to take for free.
Do what you should do, and deliver to me what you have promised. And if you can't do what you've promised me...
Hmph. You know what the consequences are.

630703.mail_desc:
The last time I ventured into your dream, Admin, I made cookies with a cookie machine... The machine was incredible. I mean, all I had to do is to press a few buttons and out came tasty cookies!
So, I told Hades that I wanted a cookie machine just like that one as a gift for my Arrival Day this year as I wanted to make everyone cookies.
But Hades says that we Omorfies kids must know how to make cookies with cookie cutters and the good old oven, because this way is the only way we can make cookies of the exact flavor and shape that we want...
Consequently, for my Arrival Day gift this year Hades gave me a big oven and lots of adorable-looking cookie cutters.
I've been working really hard since to learn how to make cookies... And Hades says I have a natural gift for making them. Although they still turn out a little burnt from time to time, now I can already make cookies in the shape of teddy bears, stars, and even Mintha's gauntlets!
Admin, if you're coming to my Arrival Day party, would you also come make cookies with me?
However, we can't have the cookies I've made yet, as I still need to learn how to make lots of other cookies to build my very own Cookie Kingdom! When the time comes, Admin, let's take part in the kingdom's parade together, shall we?

630801.mail_desc:
I've been running around non-stop lately. If it weren't for your message, I would have forgotten that today is my Arrival Day.
Given your status, the fact that you remembered such a small detail earns my respect.
As for living conditions, I've never really cared much about them. I'd rather focus my energy on missions. While you might have mentioned it out of politeness, not everyone cares about someone considered a nominally dangerous person, so I appreciate it.
I now have a clear goal with group of like-minded people. Although all things are far from pleasant, I know I'm doing the right thing.
I'm on the front lines almost every day, so I haven't had time to prepare a proper gift. I'm sending you my trusty combat knife instead; it's been very useful in the field.
If you're not interested in using it for fighting, it's also great for slicing smoked meat.
There's nothing more to say. I hope we both... go forward smoothly.

630802.mail_desc:
Dear Admin, I hope this finds you well.
Is this how you start a letter?
This year's invitation, I plan to write myself. If I leave it to Ganglati… it will say strange things again.
…Will you come to the Arrival Day party? There will be a place saved for you.
(Smudged marks)
…Ganglati said I shouldn't write like last time… it made you feel disliked.
That wasn't my intention at all. Ganglati is so nagging.
…I'm sorry, I didn't know writing like this would make you sad.
Writing letters... is such a hassle. I just want to see you...


<System Notification> Encrypted message… This is Ganglati.
She stayed up writing this letter… and fell asleep while writing.
So I'm adding a final note on her behalf. Remember to prepare early, Miss's party starts on time, don't be late.
You know, you're the only one she invited.

7000.mail_desc:
Dear Admin, the entrance to the %s event will close on %s, and the redemption portal will close on %s.
Swiggsy would like to give you some Swigs as a gift, so make sure you clear the stages if you want to get some %s!
Any unused %s will be lost once the entrance is closed, so make sure you don't miss out!

8001.mail_title: Adjusted Unlock Requirements for Hazard Zone Cleaning
8001.mail_desc:
Dear Admin,
In the latest update, the level requirement for unlocking the Hazard Zone Cleaning stage has been changed to Lv. 40. You will need to level up in order to have access to this stage.
As an apology for any inconvenience caused, we are sending you some of the stage rewards attached to this message. Thank you for your continued support of our game.

8002.mail_title: Adjusted Unlock Requirements for Dimensional Variable
8002.mail_desc:
Dear Admin,
In the latest update, the level requirement for unlocking the Dimensional Variable stage has been changed to Lv. 45. You will need to level up in order to have access to this stage.
As an apology for any inconvenience caused, we have attached compensation to this message. Thank you for your continued support of our game.
